intro: Thyrsanthus affinis, commonly known as the New Zealand thyrsin, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
